IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE FRESH AIR FUND, an independent, not-for-profit agency, has provided free summer vacations to more than 1.7 million New York City children from low-income families since 1877.
IRS990.MissionDescription: To provide NYC children from low-income families with cultural, recreational, and educational experiences at its camps and with volunteer host families and through such other means which may become available.
IRS990.Description: Fresh Air Camping entails sending approximately 3,000 NYC underpriviledged children to camps in Fishkill, NY. Services include recreation and career training for 2 or more weeks

Activity2.Description: The Friendly Town program consists of organizing and directing volunteer committees to recruit families to serve as hosts in local communities throughout 13 northeast States and Canada and coordinating visits by NYC underpriviledged children to the hosts families for 2 weeks or more during the summer.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Earnings from the endowment funds are used to subsidize the costs of sending underpriviledged NYC children to vacations in the country.

Effective October 1, 2009, the Fund adopted the provisions of FASB Interpretation 48 ("FIN 48"), "Accounting for Uncertainties in Income Taxes - an interpretation of FASB Statement No. 109," now incorporated in Accounting Standards Codification ("ASC") Topic 740, which provides standards for establishing and classifying any tax provisions for uncertain positions. The adoption of FIN 48 did not have an effect on the Fund's financial position as of September 30, 2010.
Pension changes other than net periodic costs

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The information to prepare Form 990 is collected by various members of the organization's Finance office. The Form 990 is prepared by the organization's CFO, reviewed by the Executive Director and presented to the Audit Committee for approval. Upon approval, the Form 990 is made available to the full governing board.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: At the organization's annual meeting, a reaffirmation of the conflict of interest policy is distributed and members are requested to individually sign-off that they are aware of and will report any conflicts that exist. The sign-off forms are collected by the organization and kept on file.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization's CFO prepares annually a salary survey of the key management positions in the organization, including the Executive Director. Such salary data are collected from various well-known and publicly available sources. Comparative metrics of peer groups by budget and asset size, nature and scope of services, and geographic proximity are developed and presented to the orgnaization's Executive Committee for discussion. Within executive session of the Executive Committee meeting, the compensation level of all staff are approved as recommended by management or revised by the committee at its discretion.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: All documents which must be made available to the public can be obtained electronically upon request or on our website.

The Fresh Air Fund rents a catering facility for its special events operated by Pier Sixty, LLC, which is located at Chelsea Piers. Pier Sixty, LLC is a joint venture between AK Pier Sixty, LLC, a catering company, and Chelsea Piers LP. Chelsea Piers Management Inc. is the managing partner of Chelsea Piers, LP. A board member of the Fund, Tom Bernstein, is the President of Chelsea Piers Management, Inc.
